Consuetudo, vel lex mercatoria, or The ancient law-merchant Diuided into three parts: according to the essentiall parts of trafficke. Necessarie for all statesmen, iudges, magistrates, temporall and ciuile lawyers, mint-men, merchants, marriners, and all others negotiating in all places of the world. By Gerard Malynes merchant. Malynes, Gerard, fl. 1586-1641.
[16], 501, [3] p.
Printed by Adam Islip, London : Anno Dom. 1622.
Running title reads: Lex mercatoria. The first leaf and the last leaf are blank. Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
=======
